text: hey guys I'm going to Africa for two
months in January and February 2018 but
I'm not going back to North Africa where
had been several times
I'm heading deep into sub-saharan Africa
for a completely new and enriching
travel experience my planned route is to
start in South Africa and work my way up
to Ethiopia hitting every country along
the way as my trip approaches I've been
educating myself more and more about the
people culture and lifestyle in the
countries I'll be visiting I've been
thinking long and hard about how I can
leverage my social media following and
video making skills to do some charity
work because to me
nothing is more fulfilling than helping
people who need it I've decided to bring
awareness to the water crisis because
reading about it has affected me the
most nearly four hundred million people
in sub-saharan Africa don't have access
to the most basic of all human needs
clean and drinkable water that's one in
every three people on the continent
without clean water you can't stay in
school you can't grow food you can't go
to work and you can't stay healthy
children under five are the most
vulnerable where water-related diseases
are claiming the lives of 4,000 kids
every day the United Nations estimates
that sub-saharan Africa alone loses 40
billion hours per year collecting water
and bringing it back to their homes
spending hours and hours every day
collecting water takes away any
opportunities to learn grow and work if
we help to fix the water crisis which is
solvable the children can get back to
school
parents can run small businesses and
most importantly people will live longer
and happier lives I stumbled across this
product called the straw which basically
makes any contaminated water safe to
drink
you simply wear it around your neck
stick it in any water source and suck
normally like a straw the water is
purified as it passes through the filler
and into your body my idea is to deliver
10,000 straws in person to people who
don't have access to clean water on my
trip to Africa after some thorough
research I shared my idea to a charity
called water is life whose mission is to
provide clean drinking water sanitation
and hygiene education programs to
schools and villages in need since 2009
they have produced three and a half
million
leaders of clean water they hopped on
board and introduced me to a village in
kusuma Kenya whose residents are in
desperate need for clean water I was
already planning to visit Kenya on my
trip so it works out perfectly Kenya it
is here's how this is going to work you
can do one of four things a doughnut be
shared this video see doughnut and share
this video or D do nothing if you'd like
to donate you can do so by paypal debit
or credit card on the link below and
I'll be making videos on the ground
showing exactly which kids are getting
clean water from your donation if
everyone following this page donates $1
we'd have a quarter of a million dollars
sharing this video will help me spread
awareness about the ongoing water crisis
and my mission to deliver straws to
people in need your friends your family
members your high school acquaintances
and the backpacker you met in Thailand
the more eyeballs that see this video
the better I've decided to personally
donate ten cents for every share this
video gets so 1000 shares equals one
hundred dollars donated ten thousand
shares a thousand dollars water is life
agreed to provide one straw for every
ten shares so one thousand shares is
also a hundred straws and ten thousand
shares is a thousand straws hold
disclosure I am in no way shape or form
getting paid or compensated by water is
life all travel expenses to Kenya are on
me I understand if you're not in a
position to donate but the least you can
do to help me raise awareness is share
this video I help me achieve my goals to
deliver 10,000 straws let's make this
world a better place one step at a time
[Applause]
